reviews.review: Всё просто! Half-Life 2, но все достоинства приумножены в несколько раз.
amazing i love it so much and dog is the best dog

Honestly I kinda prefer this over Episode 1 and base Half-Life 2. It's more enjoyable, the story takes some interesting turns and each level definitely feels unique, which I thought was definitely lacking in Episode 1. Including achievements, my time came up to 13.6 hours, which I enjoyed a lot. The game improves not only in small areas, but adds a few new and cool enemies. Antlion workers add an interesting way of dealing with antlions. You can't just shoot as mindlessly anymore. You have to be careful with the acid they spit and and avoid getting too close, as doing such will certainly result in death, or at least getting heavily injured. The antlion grubs, while not an enemy also allow the game to add some interesting things for a while. When you kill them, they will drop some health for Gordon to collect, while not much. My only complaint with them is that you'll be given a random amount of health from 1 to 10, and it remains inconsistent from my experiences. Even then, there's one more enemy that I think is worth mentioning; the combine hunter. While intimidating at first, I think the hunter is a great experience. Especially in the later chapters they prove to kinda be difficult, which helps make the game more refreshing, but they can tank a lot of damage while dealing a bunch easily. While the car definitely makes their impact a lot weaker, since you can just... run them over, they're still interesting for at least a good amount of the game, even with the inclusion of the car. There's too much to really talk about that honestly, it's worth checking out by itself, to be honest.

The Half-Life games are one of the most, if not *the* most, beautifully written and fantastically executed series out there. No other non-VR game comes even close to the level of immersion created by the developers, from the intensity and mayhem of combat with massive, alien biomechanical weapons and ships, down to way a bottle falls and rolls. Even though I know the entire plot of each and every game and episode, I find myself constantly surprised and astounded, and there is almost always a tear shed at the end of Episode 2. There is, however, always, without fail a tear found rolling down my face upon remembering that there is no Episode 3 or Half-Life 3, nor does it seem likely to happen. To Valve, I beg of you to find as many of the original team as possible, from the code writers to the storyboard writers, and complete the series. I don't care how many years it takes to finish, so long as I am alive and well enough to play it through.
Essa é a diferença, é um jogo da Valve.

This is an amazing game, in fact I might even say it's my favorite game in the whole franchise. The gameplay is the fastest in the series, and the game wastes no time giving you all the tools you could possibly want for what is the most creative and interesting combat in the whole series. You're always kept on your toes as another big battle is always around the corner. To accompany this, the story is interesting and tense with a sense of urgency that is support by the pace of the gameplay. That's not even mentioning the music, easily the best in the franchise.

Although there is one glaring problem with all of it, a problem that in the grand scheme of things doesn't mean much but a problem nonetheless. This has got to be one of the most frustrating, tedious games to 100% complete. I swear to god the achievements in this game were designed by a team of elite scientists with the sole purpose of pissing you off. Crush 333 bugs. Carry this stupid fucking gnome across the entire game while it constantly gets blown away and falls out of your car. (Or launches you 40,000 feet in the air if it's feeling really frisky.) I've seriously never been more pissed off at a game as I was when 100% completing this one, but there's no denying how rewarding it was.

Overall, it's an amazing game that I can't recommend enough, but please, only go for every achievement if you really hate yourself.
Valve really needs to get over their fear of the number 3
